intro: Polybotrya prolifera, commonly known as the creeping broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and as a ground cover in suitable climates.
